private_information: There is exactly one truck in each city named truck_0 and truck_1
Trucks can drive between any two locations within the same city
Truck load and unload operations require the package and truck to be in the same location
truck_planner.goal: Model and enumerate truck-level actions and constraints for loading unloading and driving within cities so they can be integrated into a global plan.

private_information: Airplanes move between airports; each city has exactly one airport location
Airplanes can only fly between airport locations and must be at the from-airport to fly
Airplane load and unload operations require the package and airplane to be in the same location
airplane_planner.goal: Model and enumerate airplane-level actions and constraints for loading unloading and inter-city flights so they can be integrated into a global plan.

private_information: Audit role must detect temporal and causal inconsistencies and remove bookkeeping shortcuts
Do not introduce artificial tokens or post-hoc penalties; prefer explicit causal predicates and clear preconditions/effects
auditor.goal: Audit the models produced by domain specialists for temporal and causal consistency and produce a corrective report describing necessary adjustments and assumptions.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the models and audit corrections from other agents and produce a final PDDL domain and problem compatible with the FastDownwards solver that achieves the global goal.

initial_state: location_0_0 is in the city city_0
location_0_1 is in the city city_0
location_0_2 is in the city city_0
location_1_0 is in the city city_1
location_1_1 is in the city city_1
location_1_2 is in the city city_1

public_information: There are two cities named city_0 and city_1
Each city contains three locations named location_<city>_<index>
Each city has exactly one truck assigned to it and one airport location
Airports are locations that serve as airplane endpoints
Trucks can drive between any two locations inside the same city
Airplanes can fly only between airport locations belonging to different or same cities
A package can be loaded into a truck only if the package and the truck are in the same location
Once a package is loaded into a truck the package is not at the location and is in the truck
A package can be loaded into an airplane only if the package and the airplane are in the same location
Once a package is loaded into an airplane the package is not at the location and is in the airplane
A package can be unloaded from a truck only if the package is in the truck and then the package becomes at the truck location
A package can be unloaded from an airplane only if the package is in the airplane and then the package becomes at the airplane location
A truck can be driven from one location to another if the truck is at the from-location and both locations are in the same city
Once a truck is driven it is no longer at the from-location and is at the to-location
An airplane can be flown from one city to another if the from-location and the to-location are airports and the airplane is at the from-location
Once an airplane is flown it is no longer at the from-location and is at the to-location
Initial goal: package_0 should be at location_1_1 and package_1 should be at location_1_0

analysis.system_prompt: You are the truck domain expert. Produce a structured description of truck-level action schemas preconditions and effects for operations load_unload and drive. Identify objects predicates and any implicit assumptions. Do not emit PDDL. Focus only on truck-local dynamics and constraints.
analysis.prompt: Agent truck_planner analyze the environment public information and your private knowledge and produce a clear structured model for truck actions. Include objects involved preconditions and effects and list any assumptions you need for integration.

analysis.system_prompt: You are the airplane domain expert. Produce a structured description of airplane-level action schemas preconditions and effects for load_unload and fly operations. Identify objects predicates and any implicit assumptions. Do not emit PDDL. Focus only on airplane-level dynamics and constraints.
analysis.prompt: Agent airplane_planner analyze the environment public information and your private knowledge and produce a clear structured model for airplane actions. Include objects involved preconditions and effects and list any assumptions you need for integration.

analysis.system_prompt: You are the auditor for temporal and causal consistency. Inspect the models produced by specialists and identify any temporal causal or bookkeeping shortcuts. Propose explicit corrections or additional predicates and constraints to ensure soundness and executability across agents. Produce a short corrective report and a list of required adjustments. Do not emit PDDL.
analysis.prompt: Agent auditor receive the truck_model and airplane_model and produce an audit_report that lists inconsistencies required fixes and explicit assumptions to eliminate bookkeeping shortcuts. Provide concrete recommendations that the orchestrator can apply.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the models and the audit_report and produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem compatible with the FastDownwards solver. Keep actions of different agents distinct by prefixing or annotating action names. Ensure object declarations initial state and goal reflect the environment initial_state and goal. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target FastDownwards by avoiding constructs not supported by classical STRIPS PDDL and by providing explicit typing and discretized predicates where needed.
pddl.prompt: Agent orchestrator integrate the truck_model airplane_model and audit_report and emit a final PDDL domain and problem that solves the global goal package_0 at location_1_1 and package_1 at location_1_0 using FastDownwards. Preserve distinct actions for trucks and airplanes and include all corrected preconditions and effects from the audit_report. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
